classes

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • classes.User

  • public class User
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is central to n3twork, which is to be expected from a social network. Most of the db queries are found here. An object of this class represents a user in the network.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Empty constructor: always handy

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      User addFriendToDB(int friendID)

      • convertUserListToJson

        public static java.lang.String convertUserListToJson(java.util.List<User> users)
                                              throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                     java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Converts any list of users to a json string
        Parameters:
        users - - users in the list don't necessarily need to have it's attributes set
        Returns:
        {
  "userList":[
    {
      "id":userID,
      "username":"username",
      "email":"em@il",
      "emailhash":"hash of email",
      "lastName":"name",
      "firstName":"firstName",
      "otherProperties:{
        "property1":"value",
        "property2":"value",
      }
    },
  ],
  successful":true
}
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

                                         java.lang.IllegalAccessException,

      • registerInDB

        public java.lang.Boolean registerInDB()
                               throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                      java.sql.SQLException
        Inserts the User object into the database if there is no entry with the same username or email.
        Returns:
        true if the registration was successful; false if either, neither username nor email are given, or the user already exists.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.InstantiationException

      • createSessionID

        public java.lang.String createSessionID()
                                 throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                        java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                        java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                        java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a sessionID as an md5 of the username and the current time and saves it in the db
        Returns:
        sessionID - md5(this.username + System.currentTimeMillis())
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.lang.InstantiationException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException

    },
  ],
  "successful":true
}

      • addFriendToDB

        public User addFriendToDB(int friendID)
                   throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                          java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          java.sql.SQLException
        Inserts a user with given userID into the Friends table on the db. There is no need to also put them in the friends attribute, because every time the friends list is requested getFromDB() is called, which does the same.
        Parameters:
        friendID - - id of the added friend
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • removeFriend

        public User removeFriend(int friendID)
                  throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                         java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                         java.sql.SQLException
        Deletes given friend 
         DELETE FROM Friends WHERE userID=this.id AND friendID=friendID
        Parameters:
        friendID - - id of the to be deleted friend
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException
